links.*: Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien

wikitext.*:
[[File:R.W. Chambers 21 December 1933.jpg|thumb]] On [[21 December]] [[1933]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to [[R.W. Chambers]]'''. Either with the letter or separately, Tolkien also sends Chambers a manuscript version of his poem [[Visio de Doworst]].{{webcite|author=[[Christina Scull]], [[Wayne G. Hammond]]|articleurl=http://www.hammondandscull.com/addenda/chronology.html|articlename=Addenda and Corrigenda to ''The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide'' (2006) Vol. 1: Chronology|dated=|website=HS|accessed=14 April 2014}} *'''Subject:''' Christmas greetings. *'''Description:''' 1 page, handwritten."Fantasy that! — a Tolkien original", in [[Monash Review 3 (1975)|''Monash Review'', Nr. 3 (1975)]], p. 2 *'''Publication:''' A transcript of the letter was published in the [[Monash Review 3 (1975)|''Monash Review'', Nr. 3 (1975)]]. ==Transcription== {{blockquote|My Dear Chambers,

Thank you for your note. I am sorry you are — or were — unwell. My very best wishes for a happy feast and for all blessings in 1934.

Yrs very sincerely,
J.R.R. Tolkien

I send you - it may possibly amuse you — a report on last year's Examinations in Oxford: held by myself, [[Charles Leslie Wrenn|Wrenn]], Brett-Smith & [[C.S. Lewis]] (whose ''Pilgrim's Regress'' you may have read). The howlers are genuine except the nonsense about Percy S.

Yrs
J.R.R.T.}} ==See also== *[[Visio de Doworst]] (poem) {{references}} [[Category:Letters|Chambers, R.W.]]
